title: Quarto Bibliography Notes
text:
Preface
References are important!




Nishi, T., Itahashi, K., Ahn, D., Berg, G. P. A., Dozono, M., Etoh, D., Fujioka, H., Fukuda, N., Fukunishi, N., Geissel, H., Haettner, E., Hashimoto, T., Hayano, R. S., Hirenzaki, S., Horii, H., Ikeno, N., Inabe, N., Iwasaki, M., Kameda, D., … Collaboration, piAF. (2023). Chiral symmetry restoration at high matter density observed in pionic atoms. Nature Physics, 19(6), 788–793. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41567-023-02001-x


Ren, Y., Yang, Y., Wang, Y., & Liu, Y. (2023). Dynamics of the global semiconductor trade and its dependencies. Journal of Geographical Sciences, 33(6), 1141–1160. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11442-023-2123-9

title: Citation Styles
text:
There are many citation styles available for your use. Quarto uses the Chicago Manual of Style (CMOS) by default but you can include any of the Citation Style Language (CSL) files from this official GitHub repository to use instead.
Here, I am using the apa.csl file to implement American Psychological Association (APA) formatting for my reference list. To obtain and use a CSL file in your Quarto book, go to the repo, scroll through until you find one you want, click on it, and download the raw file. Put that in your Quarto files and then update your .yml file to contain `csl: .csl”.




Nishi, T., Itahashi, K., Ahn, D., Berg, G. P. A., Dozono, M., Etoh, D., Fujioka, H., Fukuda, N., Fukunishi, N., Geissel, H., Haettner, E., Hashimoto, T., Hayano, R. S., Hirenzaki, S., Horii, H., Ikeno, N., Inabe, N., Iwasaki, M., Kameda, D., … Collaboration, piAF. (2023). Chiral symmetry restoration at high matter density observed in pionic atoms. Nature Physics, 19(6), 788–793. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41567-023-02001-x


Ren, Y., Yang, Y., Wang, Y., & Liu, Y. (2023). Dynamics of the global semiconductor trade and its dependencies. Journal of Geographical Sciences, 33(6), 1141–1160. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11442-023-2123-9

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Article
@article{CitekeyArticle,
  author   = "P. J. Cohen",
  title    = "The independence of the continuum hypothesis",
  journal  = "Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences",
  year     = 1963,
  volume   = "50",
  number   = "6",
  pages    = "1143--1148",
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Book
@book{CitekeyBook,
  author    = "Leonard Susskind and George Hrabovsky",
  title     = "Classical mechanics: the theoretical minimum",
  publisher = "Penguin Random House",
  address   = "New York, NY",
  year      = 2014
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Booklet
@booklet{CitekeyBooklet,
  title        = "Canoe tours in {S}weden",
  author       = "Maria Swetla", 
  howpublished = "Distributed at the Stockholm Tourist Office",
  month        = jul,
  year         = 2015
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Conference
See inproceedings.

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
In Book
@inbook{CitekeyInbook,
  author    = "Lisa A. Urry and Michael L. Cain and Steven A. Wasserman and Peter V. Minorsky and Jane B. Reece",
  title     = "Photosynthesis",
  booktitle = "Campbell Biology",
  year      = "2016",
  publisher = "Pearson",
  address   = "New York, NY",
  pages     = "187--221"
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
In Collection
@incollection{CitekeyIncollection,
  author    = "Shapiro, Howard M.",
  editor    = "Hawley, Teresa S. and Hawley, Robert G.",
  title     = "Flow Cytometry: The Glass Is Half Full",
  booktitle = "Flow Cytometry Protocols",
  year      = 2018,
  publisher = "Springer",
  address   = "New York, NY",
  pages     = "1--10"
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
In Proceedings
@inproceedings{CitekeyInproceedings,
  author    = "Holleis, Paul and Wagner, Matthias and Koolwaaij, Johan",
  title     = "Studying mobile context-aware social services in the wild",
  booktitle = "Proc. of the 6th Nordic Conf. on Human-Computer Interaction",
  series    = "NordiCHI",
  year      = 2010,
  pages     = "207--216",
  publisher = "ACM",
  address   = "New York, NY"
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Manual
@manual{CitekeyManual,
  title        = "{R}: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing",
  author       = "{R Core Team}",
  organization = "R Foundation for Statistical Computing",
  address      = "Vienna, Austria",
  year         = 2018
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Masters Thesis
@mastersthesis{CitekeyMastersthesis,
  author  = "Jian Tang",
  title   = "Spin structure of the nucleon in the asymptotic limit",
  school  = "Massachusetts Institute of Technology",
  year    = 1996,
  address = "Cambridge, MA",
  month   = sep
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Miscellaneous
Often used for content published on web pages, personal notes, or other content that isn’t easily categorized into one of these standard types.
@misc{CitekeyMisc,
  title        = "Pluto: The 'Other' Red Planet",
  author       = "{NASA}",
  howpublished = "\url{https://www.nasa.gov/nh/pluto-the-other-red-planet}",
  year         = 2015,
  note         = "Accessed: 2018-12-06"
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Phd Thesis
@phdthesis{CitekeyPhdthesis,
  author  = "Rempel, Robert Charles",
  title   = "Relaxation Effects for Coupled Nuclear Spins",
  school  = "Stanford University",
  address = "Stanford, CA",
  year    = 1956,
  month   = jun
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Proceedings
@proceedings{CitekeyProceedings,
  editor    = "Susan Stepney and Sergey Verlan",
  title     = "Proceedings of the 17th International Conference on Computation and Natural Computation, Fontainebleau, France",
  series    = "Lecture Notes in Computer Science",
  volume    = "10867",
  publisher = "Springer",
  address   = "Cham, Switzerland",
  year      = 2018
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Tech Report
@techreport{CitekeyTechreport,
  title       = "{W}asatch {S}olar {P}roject Final Report",
  author      = "Bennett, Vicki and Bowman, Kate and Wright, Sarah",
  institution = "Salt Lake City Corporation",
  address     = "Salt Lake City, UT",
  number      = "DOE-SLC-6903-1",
  year        = 2018,
  month       = sep
}

title: The 14 BibTeX Entry Types
text:
Unpublished
@unpublished{CitekeyUnpublished,
  author = "Mohinder Suresh",
  title  = "Evolution: a revised theory",
  year   = 2006
}

title: The RIS Format
text:
According to this page on Wikipedia, “RIS is a standardized tag format developed by Research Information Systems, Incorporated (the format name refers to the company) to enable citation programs to exchange data.[1] It is supported by a number of reference managers. Many digital libraries, like IEEE Xplore, Scopus, the ACM Portal, Scopemed, ScienceDirect, SpringerLink, Rayyan, Accordance Bible Software,[2] and online library catalogs can export citations in this format. Citation management applications can export and import citations in this format.”
An example of a journal article is given as:
TY  - JOUR
AU  - Shannon, Claude E.
PY  - 1948
DA  - July
TI  - A Mathematical Theory of Communication
T2  - Bell System Technical Journal
SP  - 379
EP  - 423
VL  - 27
ER  -
The abbreviations are type (TY), author (AU), publication year (PY), date (DA), primary title (T1), secondary title (T2), starting page (SP), ending page (EP), volume number (VL), and a special “end of reference” (ER) one at the end that is empty to indicate the termination of this entry. There are many other fields available so be sure to read that Wikipedia article for more information.




Nishi, T., Itahashi, K., Ahn, D., Berg, G. P. A., Dozono, M., Etoh, D., Fujioka, H., Fukuda, N., Fukunishi, N., Geissel, H., Haettner, E., Hashimoto, T., Hayano, R.
